meanings.definition: (verb) to make the characteristic cry of a sheep or goat
meanings.sent1: The lamb would bleat loudly when it was hungry.
meanings.sent2: The goats bleat happily in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The sheep decided to bleat a song for the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a bleat.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bleat filled the air with warmth.

meanings.definition: (noun) the characteristic cry of a sheep or goat
meanings.sent1: The bleat of the sheep was heard across the farm.
meanings.sent2: A soft bleat could be heard from the barn.
meanings.sent3: The farmer imitated the bleat to entertain the children.
meanings.sent4: The bleat of the goat was a melody in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The familiar bleat brought a smile to her face.
